suncertify.server

Class RemoteBookingData

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
      • java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
        • java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
          • suncertify.server.RemoteBookingData
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote, java.rmi.server.Unreferenced, RemoteBookingDB

    public class RemoteBookingData
extends java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
implements RemoteBookingDB, java.rmi.server.Unreferenced
    This implementation of the RemoteBookingDB interface allows remote clients to access the database. One instanace per client is created on the server.

    A note of the record currently locked by the remote client is kept so that if the client dies or the network connection is lost the record can be unlocked on the server.

    Author:
    Nick Shrine
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • find

        public int[] find(java.lang.String[] criteria)
           throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Returns an array of record numbers that match the specified criteria. Field n in the database file is described by criteria[n]. A null value in criteria[n] matches any field value. A non-null value in criteria[n] matches any field value that begins with criteria[n]. (For example, "Fred" matches "Fred" or "Freddy".)
        Specified by:
        find in interface RemoteBookingDB
        Parameters:
        criteria - the criteria to be matched.
        Returns:
        an array of record numbers that match the specified criteria.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if there is a communication problem between the server and client.

      • lock

        public long lock(int recNo)
          throws RecordNotFoundException,
                 java.rmi.RemoteException
        Locks a record so that it can only be updated or deleted by this client. Returned value is a cookie that must be used when the record is unlocked, updated, or deleted. If the specified record is already locked by a different client, the current thread gives up the CPU and consumes no CPU cycles until the record is unlocked.
        Specified by:
        lock in interface RemoteBookingDB
        Parameters:
        recNo - the record number of the record to be locked.
        Returns:
        a cookie that must be used when the record is unlocked, updated, or deleted.
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException - if the record does not exists or there is an error accessing the database.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if there is a communication problem between the server and client.

      • unlock

        public void unlock(int recNo,
                   long cookie)
            throws RecordNotFoundException,
                   SecurityException,
                   java.rmi.RemoteException
        Releases the lock on a record. Cookie must be the cookie returned when the record was locked; otherwise throws SecurityException.
        Specified by:
        unlock in interface RemoteBookingDB
        Parameters:
        recNo - the record number of the record to be unlocked.
        cookie - the cookie that the record was locked with.
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException - if the record does not exist or there is an error accessing the database.
        SecurityException - if the record is locked with a cookie other than cookie.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if there is a communication problem between the server and client.

      • findExact

        public int[] findExact(java.lang.String[] criteria,
                       int operator)
                throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Returns records that exactly match the specified criteria. An operator type must be specified to determine the type of matching to be done.
        Specified by:
        findExact in interface RemoteBookingDB
        Parameters:
        criteria - the criteria to be matched.
        operator - the type of match to be performed, either AND or OR.
        Returns:
        an array of record numbers that match the specified criteria.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if there is a communication problem between the server and client.

      • unreferenced

        public void unreferenced()
        Called by the RMI runtime sometime after the runtime determines that the connection to the client has been lost. If the client had locked a record in the database when the connection was lost then it is unlocked.

        The unreferenced flag is also set so that if a thread on the server side is waiting to obtain a lock on a record when the client dies it will immediately release the lock once it has obtained it.

        Specified by:
        unreferenced in interface java.rmi.server.Unreferenced
